alert.note: Alert for Oregon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 14 at 12:01AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. This replaces the Flash Flood Warning previously in effect. * WHERE...A portion of south central Missouri, including the following county, Oregon. * WHEN...Until 900 AM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1201 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 5 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thayer, Koshkonong, Couch, Myrtle and Grand Gulf State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
